trans-unit.source: How to Use the Flat File Schema Wizard
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Flat File Schema Wizard

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough shows you how to create a flat file schema from a document instance using the Flat File Schema Wizard based on the following sample purchase order:
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough shows you how to create a flat file schema from a document instance using the Flat File Schema Wizard based on the following sample purchase order:

trans-unit.source: Each line of the purchase order ends with a carriage return line feed (CRLF), marked in green.
trans-unit.target: Each line of the purchase order ends with a carriage return line feed (CRLF), marked in green.

trans-unit.source: The purchase order starts with a PO tag shown in red and followed by a date.
trans-unit.target: The purchase order starts with a PO tag shown in red and followed by a date.

trans-unit.source: Two repeating fixed positional fields contain customer information and are shown in purple.
trans-unit.target: Two repeating fixed positional fields contain customer information and are shown in purple.

trans-unit.source: After the comment field, there is a repeating field starting with an ITEMS tag that contains multiple records delimited by commas (,) and data values separated by pipes (|), which are shown in blue.
trans-unit.target: After the comment field, there is a repeating field starting with an ITEMS tag that contains multiple records delimited by commas (,) and data values separated by pipes (|), which are shown in blue.

trans-unit.source: To prepare the document instance for the walkthrough, copy the following to notepad and save it as a text file:
trans-unit.target: To prepare the document instance for the walkthrough, copy the following to notepad and save it as a text file:

trans-unit.source: To use the Flat File Schema wizard
trans-unit.target: To use the Flat File Schema wizard

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, create a new BizTalk Service Project.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, create a new BizTalk Service Project.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create an Enterprise Application Integration Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create an Enterprise Application Integration Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: To add the new flat file schema, right-click the project, and click <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>New Item</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add the new flat file schema, right-click the project, and click <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>New Item</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Add New Item</ui> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Generate Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel>, enter a name for the schema, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Add New Item</ui> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Generate Flat File Schema</embeddedLabel>, enter a name for the schema, and then click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The Flat File Schema Wizard starts.
trans-unit.target: The Flat File Schema Wizard starts.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Flat File Schema Information</ui> screen, select your instance and enter the following information.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Flat File Schema Information</ui> screen, select your instance and enter the following information.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Instance file:</ui> Click the <ui>Browse</ui> button to locate the flat file from which the schema will be generated.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Instance file:</ui> Click the <ui>Browse</ui> button to locate the flat file from which the schema will be generated.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the folder containing the text file you created in the Prerequisites section.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the folder containing the text file you created in the Prerequisites section.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Record name:</ui> Type <userInputLocalizable>PO</userInputLocalizable> as it will be the schema root name.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Record name:</ui> Type <userInputLocalizable>PO</userInputLocalizable> as it will be the schema root name.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Target namespace:</ui> Type <userInputLocalizable>http://EnterpriseApplicationIntegration.PurchaseOrder</userInputLocalizable> for schema target namespace.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Target namespace:</ui> Type <userInputLocalizable>http://EnterpriseApplicationIntegration.PurchaseOrder</userInputLocalizable> for schema target namespace.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> screen, the contents of the flat file are displayed.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> screen, the contents of the flat file are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the data needed for creating the schema, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select the data needed for creating the schema, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In this walkthrough, because we are using the entire document instance, you can press <ui>Ctrl-A</ui> to select all.
trans-unit.target: In this walkthrough, because we are using the entire document instance, you can press <ui>Ctrl-A</ui> to select all.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> screen, you specify whether the records are formatted using a delimiter symbol or by defining relative positions.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> screen, you specify whether the records are formatted using a delimiter symbol or by defining relative positions.

trans-unit.source: In the instance message we chose, the purchase order records end with a carriage return line feed (CRLF), hence select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the instance message we chose, the purchase order records end with a carriage return line feed (CRLF), hence select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> screen, enter the following to define the first level of the schema and when you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> screen, enter the following to define the first level of the schema and when you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Child delimiter:</ui> Select <ui>{CR}{LF}</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Child delimiter:</ui> Select <ui>{CR}{LF}</ui>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Child delimiter</ui> property is an editable box with drop down selection list contains a set of default values.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Child delimiter</ui> property is an editable box with drop down selection list contains a set of default values.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Child delimiter</ui> can be specified as a character or as a hexadecimal value.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Child delimiter</ui> can be specified as a character or as a hexadecimal value.

trans-unit.source: For example, <userInputLocalizable>\{</userInputLocalizable> or <userInputLocalizable>{0x0D0A}</userInputLocalizable>.
trans-unit.target: For example, <userInputLocalizable>\{</userInputLocalizable> or <userInputLocalizable>{0x0D0A}</userInputLocalizable>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Escape character:</ui> An escape character is a single character that suppresses any special meaning of the character that follows it.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Escape character:</ui> An escape character is a single character that suppresses any special meaning of the character that follows it.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Escape Characters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=245838</linkUri></externalLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Escape Characters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=245838</linkUri></externalLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: For this walkthrough, leave this blank.
trans-unit.target: For this walkthrough, leave this blank.

trans-unit.source: When using <userInputLocalizable>\</userInputLocalizable>, <userInputLocalizable>{,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>}</userInputLocalizable> for <ui>Child delimiter</ui> or <ui>Escape character</ui>, a back slash must be used.
trans-unit.target: When using <userInputLocalizable>\</userInputLocalizable>, <userInputLocalizable>{,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>}</userInputLocalizable> for <ui>Child delimiter</ui> or <ui>Escape character</ui>, a back slash must be used.

trans-unit.source: For example, <userInputLocalizable>\\,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>\{</userInputLocalizable>.
trans-unit.target: For example, <userInputLocalizable>\\,</userInputLocalizable> and <userInputLocalizable>\{</userInputLocalizable>.

trans-unit.source: Check <ui>Record has a tag identifier</ui> box and type <userInputLocalizable>PO</userInputLocalizable> in the <ui>Tag</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: Check <ui>Record has a tag identifier</ui> box and type <userInputLocalizable>PO</userInputLocalizable> in the <ui>Tag</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: If there are more than one flat file message types being processed by the bridge, this tag is used to identify which flat-file schema to validate the incoming message against.
trans-unit.target: If there are more than one flat file message types being processed by the bridge, this tag is used to identify which flat-file schema to validate the incoming message against.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: The wizard identifies four elements in the purchase order record; you must now define the element property.
trans-unit.target: The wizard identifies four elements in the purchase order record; you must now define the element property.

trans-unit.source: Make changes as illustrated in the following table:
trans-unit.target: Make changes as illustrated in the following table:

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Element Type
trans-unit.target: Element Type

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInput>date</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInput>date</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Field Element</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Field Element</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>date</userInput>
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>date</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInputLocalizable>customer</userInputLocalizable>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInputLocalizable>customer</userInputLocalizable>

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Repeating record</ui>
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Repeating record</ui>

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Ignore</ui>
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Ignore</ui>

trans-unit.source: You set this to <embeddedLabel>Ignore</embeddedLabel> because you have already specified <embeddedLabel>Repeating Record</embeddedLabel> for the <embeddedLabel>customer</embeddedLabel> element.
trans-unit.target: You set this to <embeddedLabel>Ignore</embeddedLabel> because you have already specified <embeddedLabel>Repeating Record</embeddedLabel> for the <embeddedLabel>customer</embeddedLabel> element.

trans-unit.source: Enter <userInputLocalizable>items</userInputLocalizable>
trans-unit.target: Enter <userInputLocalizable>items</userInputLocalizable>

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Record</ui>
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Record</ui>

trans-unit.source: You can select multiple rows and then change their <ui>Element Type</ui> to a single type by using the mouse and the SHIFT or CTRL key.
trans-unit.target: You can select multiple rows and then change their <ui>Element Type</ui> to a single type by using the mouse and the SHIFT or CTRL key.

trans-unit.source: After you click <ui>Next</ui> on the <ui>Child Elements</ui> screen, you will not be able to click <ui>Back</ui> to redefine or make any changes to the child elements.
trans-unit.target: After you click <ui>Next</ui> on the <ui>Child Elements</ui> screen, you will not be able to click <ui>Back</ui> to redefine or make any changes to the child elements.

trans-unit.source: You may need to close the wizard and launch the wizard again to define the flat file schema.
trans-unit.target: You may need to close the wizard and launch the wizard again to define the flat file schema.

trans-unit.source: After you complete the steps until here, the first level of the schema is generated as shown in the <embeddedLabel>Schema View</embeddedLabel> page.
trans-unit.target: After you complete the steps until here, the first level of the schema is generated as shown in the <embeddedLabel>Schema View</embeddedLabel> page.

trans-unit.source: Three unique elements are defined, and you will continue to further define the child records for the elements in the purchase order record.
trans-unit.target: Three unique elements are defined, and you will continue to further define the child records for the elements in the purchase order record.

trans-unit.source: Because we defined the <ui>customer</ui> element as the <ui>Repeating record</ui> type and the <ui>items</ui> element as the <ui>Record</ui> type, the Flat File Schema Wizard now continues to further define these two elements.
trans-unit.target: Because we defined the <ui>customer</ui> element as the <ui>Repeating record</ui> type and the <ui>items</ui> element as the <ui>Record</ui> type, the Flat File Schema Wizard now continues to further define these two elements.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, select <ui>customer</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, select <ui>customer</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: To work with the customer record, you need to select the data that represents that element.
trans-unit.target: To work with the customer record, you need to select the data that represents that element.

trans-unit.source: Because it is a repeating record, either of the lines can be used to define the record.
trans-unit.target: Because it is a repeating record, either of the lines can be used to define the record.

trans-unit.source: Select the first line of customer data and click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: Select the first line of customer data and click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select <ui>By relative positions</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select <ui>By relative positions</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The wizard provides a visual tool for showing and calculating the distance between the fields.
trans-unit.target: The wizard provides a visual tool for showing and calculating the distance between the fields.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Positional Record</ui> page, use the left mouse button to click the position marker to represent where the name field begins.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Positional Record</ui> page, use the left mouse button to click the position marker to represent where the name field begins.

trans-unit.source: Click the following position markers to represent the rest of the data fields:
trans-unit.target: Click the following position markers to represent the rest of the data fields:

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Position Marker
trans-unit.target: Position Marker

trans-unit.source: name
trans-unit.target: name

trans-unit.source: street
trans-unit.target: street

trans-unit.source: city
trans-unit.target: city

trans-unit.source: state
trans-unit.target: state

trans-unit.source: postalcode
trans-unit.target: postalcode

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Child Elements</ui> page, you specify the properties of the child elements.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Child Elements</ui> page, you specify the properties of the child elements.

trans-unit.source: Select the row and type names for the elements under the <ui>Element Name</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select the row and type names for the elements under the <ui>Element Name</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Leave the default values in the other columns.
trans-unit.target: Leave the default values in the other columns.

trans-unit.source: Type the following values for the properties listed in the <ui>Element Name</ui> column:
trans-unit.target: Type the following values for the properties listed in the <ui>Element Name</ui> column:

trans-unit.source: For Element Name
trans-unit.target: For Element Name

trans-unit.source: Enter Value
trans-unit.target: Enter Value

trans-unit.source: customer_Child1
trans-unit.target: customer_Child1

trans-unit.source: country
trans-unit.target: country

trans-unit.source: customer_Child2
trans-unit.target: customer_Child2

trans-unit.source: fullName
trans-unit.target: fullName

trans-unit.source: customer_Child3
trans-unit.target: customer_Child3

trans-unit.source: street
trans-unit.target: street

trans-unit.source: customer_Child4
trans-unit.target: customer_Child4

trans-unit.source: city
trans-unit.target: city

trans-unit.source: customer_Child5
trans-unit.target: customer_Child5

trans-unit.source: state
trans-unit.target: state

trans-unit.source: customer_Child6
trans-unit.target: customer_Child6

trans-unit.source: postalcode
trans-unit.target: postalcode

trans-unit.source: The child elements of the customer record are created as shown in the following screenshot of the <embeddedLabel>Schema View</embeddedLabel> page.
trans-unit.target: The child elements of the customer record are created as shown in the following screenshot of the <embeddedLabel>Schema View</embeddedLabel> page.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui> to define the child elements for the items record.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui> to define the child elements for the items record.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, select <ui>items</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, select <ui>items</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> page, select the entire line beginning with ITEMS, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to define its child elements.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> page, select the entire line beginning with ITEMS, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to define its child elements.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the Items record, commas are used to delimit the individual items.
trans-unit.target: In the Items record, commas are used to delimit the individual items.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, on the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, enter the following to define the items record.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, on the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, enter the following to define the items record.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>,</ui> from <ui>Child delimiter</ui> drop-down selection list.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>,</ui> from <ui>Child delimiter</ui> drop-down selection list.

trans-unit.source: Leave the <ui>Escape character</ui> text box blank.
trans-unit.target: Leave the <ui>Escape character</ui> text box blank.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Record has a tag identifier</ui> and type <userInputLocalizable>ITEMS</userInputLocalizable> in the <ui>Tag</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Record has a tag identifier</ui> and type <userInputLocalizable>ITEMS</userInputLocalizable> in the <ui>Tag</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: In case of multiple items record, <userInputLocalizable>ITEMS</userInputLocalizable> is used to identify each individual record.
trans-unit.target: In case of multiple items record, <userInputLocalizable>ITEMS</userInputLocalizable> is used to identify each individual record.

trans-unit.source: Using the values from the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, the wizard identifies two child elements.
trans-unit.target: Using the values from the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, the wizard identifies two child elements.

trans-unit.source: Because one of them is a repeating record, select the first element and enter <userInputLocalizable>item</userInputLocalizable> for Element Name, and then select <ui>Repeating Record</ui> from the drop down selection list for <ui>Element Type</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Because one of them is a repeating record, select the first element and enter <userInputLocalizable>item</userInputLocalizable> for Element Name, and then select <ui>Repeating Record</ui> from the drop down selection list for <ui>Element Type</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Leave the rest of the default values in the columns.
trans-unit.target: Leave the rest of the default values in the columns.

trans-unit.source: Select the second row and select the <ui>Ignore</ui> from <ui>Element Type</ui> list.
trans-unit.target: Select the second row and select the <ui>Ignore</ui> from <ui>Element Type</ui> list.

trans-unit.source: When you click <ui>Next</ui>, the next level for the items record is created in the schema.
trans-unit.target: When you click <ui>Next</ui>, the next level for the items record is created in the schema.

trans-unit.source: You continue to define the final part of the purchase order schema.
trans-unit.target: You continue to define the final part of the purchase order schema.

trans-unit.source: On the Schema View page, select <ui>item</ui> and then click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: On the Schema View page, select <ui>item</ui> and then click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> page, select <ui>ITEM872-AA|Lawnmower|1|148.95|Confirm this is electric</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Document Data</ui> page, select <ui>ITEM872-AA|Lawnmower|1|148.95|Confirm this is electric</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui> to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select the <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui> option because the individual item is delimited by a pipe (|).
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Record Format</ui> page, select the <ui>By delimiter symbol</ui> option because the individual item is delimited by a pipe (|).

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, enter the following to define the item record.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Delimited Record</ui> page, enter the following to define the item record.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>|</ui> from the <ui>Child delimiter</ui> drop down selection list.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>|</ui> from the <ui>Child delimiter</ui> drop down selection list.

trans-unit.source: Leave the <ui>Escape character</ui> text box blank.
trans-unit.target: Leave the <ui>Escape character</ui> text box blank.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Child Elements</ui> page, the wizard has identified five child elements.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Child Elements</ui> page, the wizard has identified five child elements.

trans-unit.source: Select the row and enter values for <ui>Element name</ui> properties, as shown in the table below.
trans-unit.target: Select the row and enter values for <ui>Element name</ui> properties, as shown in the table below.

trans-unit.source: Leave the default values in the rest of the columns.
trans-unit.target: Leave the default values in the rest of the columns.

trans-unit.source: For Element Name
trans-unit.target: For Element Name

trans-unit.source: Enter Value
trans-unit.target: Enter Value

trans-unit.source: item_Child1
trans-unit.target: item_Child1

trans-unit.source: productCode
trans-unit.target: productCode

trans-unit.source: item_Child2
trans-unit.target: item_Child2

trans-unit.source: description
trans-unit.target: description

trans-unit.source: item_Child3
trans-unit.target: item_Child3

trans-unit.source: quantity
trans-unit.target: quantity

trans-unit.source: item_Child4
trans-unit.target: item_Child4

trans-unit.source: unitPrice
trans-unit.target: unitPrice

trans-unit.source: item_Child5
trans-unit.target: item_Child5

trans-unit.source: notes
trans-unit.target: notes

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You have defined all the nodes for the purchase order schema.
trans-unit.target: You have defined all the nodes for the purchase order schema.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, click <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Schema View</ui> page, click <ui>Finish</ui>.
